definition: to get rid of/to put aside/to reject/to keep control/to hold (one's breath)
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: He waited for the announcement of the result of the competition with bated breath.
sentences.chinese: 他屏息靜氣地等待宣佈競賽結果。

sentences.english: When the owl sings,the nightingale will hold her peace.
More recently, breath-hold diving has become a competitive sport.
sentences.chinese: 最近，屏息潛水已經成爲一種競技運動。

sentences.english: We're all just waiting with breath to see what you can do around here.
sentences.chinese: 我們都在屏息以待，指望您在這兒大展身手咧。

sentences.english: So have we reached the breath-holding limit yet?
sentences.chinese: 那麼我們人類的屏息過程已經到達極限了嗎？

sentences.english: You steal my heart, and you take my breath away.
sentences.chinese: 你偷我的心，你把我屏息讚歎。

sentences.english: The stars hold their breath counting the hours, the feeble moon swims the deep night.
sentences.chinese: 星辰屏息地數着時刻，荏弱的月兒在夜中樸陋。

sentences.english: They waited, as it were, breathless for the result.
sentences.chinese: 他們可以說是屏息以待結果。

sentences.english: We all wait with bated breath.
Don't hold your breath, though; it'll never happen.
sentences.chinese: 但不用屏息以待，這絕不會發生。

sentences.english: Her voice compelled me forward breathlessly as I listened.
sentences.chinese: 她的聲音使我身不由主地湊上前去屏息傾聽。

sentences.english: Divers at international competitions routinely hold their breath 4-7 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 在國際競爭中的潛水員一般屏息4到7分鐘。

sentences.english: The stars hold their breath counting the hours， the feeble moon swims the deep night.
sentences.chinese: 星辰屏息地數着時間，柔弱的月兒在夜中浮泛。

sentences.english: We all waited with bated breath while she took the stage.
sentences.chinese: 當她站上舞臺時，我們都屏息以待。

sentences.english: It is right in the middle of a dark blue 17)lagoon that just is going to be heart-stopping once you see it.
sentences.chinese: 它位於深藍色的瀉湖中央，那種美看了讓人屏息。

definition: to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to prick up one's ears/to strain to hear sth
to stand respectfully/(of trees, mountains) standing tall and majestic
to exhale/to blow off steam/(phonetics) aspirated
to sit quietly/to meditate/to stage a sit-in
